column8: Test positivity is captured as a risk factor for malaria. It's more of an indicator. However, it is clear that it is a factor for risk assessment. Rural communities have lower populations and are more likely to use the nets. High population as a factor may take the nets to communities that may not use them, and also there may not be significant net savings when nets go to wards with highest populations. The balance of population as a factor needs good attention. Housing should be captured as "poor housing" to be specific as having a direct relationship with malaria.

column6: I would adopt it because it will me deploy interventions to where they are needed
